Intro.text:
This page is for
pediatric
patients. For adult patients, see:
dehydration

Clinical_Features.text:
Decreased urine output
Sunken fontanelle
Most reliable:
[1]
Abnormal capillary refill
Abnormal respiratory pattern
Decreased skin turgor

Management.text:
Ondansteron
for
vomiting
Mild to moderate dehydration: start with trial of
oral rehydration therapy
or half strength apple juice
[2]
[3]
Part of
ACEP Choosing wisely
Provide ORS solution (e.g. Pedialyte) at 50 to 100 mL/kg over 2-4 hours in small doses q5min
If the child vomits, wait 15 minutes then try again
Provide additional ORS to replace ongoing GI losses
Consider
Fluid Repletion (IVF)
only if severely dehydrated, not tolerating oral intake or failed oral rehydration therapy
